criteria: Identification of common mental health conditions.
Explanation of the importance of seeking professional help.
Clarity and accuracy of information presented.
descriptions: Student does not identify any mental health conditions.
Student identifies one common mental health condition with significant inaccuracies.
Student identifies one common mental health condition with minor inaccuracies, or identifies two conditions but lacks detail.
Student accurately identifies two common mental health conditions.
Student accurately identifies three common mental health conditions and provides basic descriptions.
Student accurately identifies multiple common mental health conditions and provides detailed descriptions.
Student does not explain why seeking professional help is important.
Student provides a vague or inaccurate reason for seeking professional help.
Student provides a basic reason for seeking professional help, but lacks detail or clarity.
Student explains one clear reason why seeking professional help is important.
Student explains two clear reasons why seeking professional help is important.
Student comprehensively explains multiple reasons why seeking professional help is important, including potential benefits and consequences of not seeking help.
Information presented is unclear, inaccurate, or irrelevant.
Information presented is somewhat unclear or contains significant inaccuracies.
Information presented is mostly clear, but contains some minor inaccuracies.
Information presented is clear and mostly accurate.
Information presented is clear, accurate, and well-organized.
Information presented is exceptionally clear, accurate, well-organized, and demonstrates a thorough understanding of the topic.
